utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Damn it. I waited too long.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Please, come on, do something! Come on, do something! Do something!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You couldn't have saved her.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's your choice if you wanna go back on drugs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think I can fix myself?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I just need to know if you and I can work.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Let me see. It's okay. It's gonna get infected.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, you're not gonna... You are. No. Don't, don't.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's okay. I love you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So now what?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Everything's good. We don't have to talk through it all.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I meant it literally. Now what? We could make breakfast. We could go bowling. We could stay here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I have to go home and get dressed and go to work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So that's it?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm hoping this is the beginning of it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. Your assistant's new. It's a 50/50 chance he just... can't find the light switch. Hello?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, this is Dr. Cuddy's nanny. She's, uh, feeling a little under the weather now, so she won't be coming in today.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Oh. I hope she's all right. Would you mind asking her if—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. Can't do that. I'm afraid she's locked in the bathroom. Terrible bug going around. What's the problem?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Well, I'm sorry to disturb her, but it's Dr. Richardson. He must have the same stomach flu. He threw up in the O.R., and I'm not sure how she'd want me to—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hold on a second. I've talked to Dr. Cuddy, and she would like you to do three things : One — send him home, two — sterilize the O.R., three — use your own brain. See ya. It's about puke. That's what's so important. Puke.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, I guess I don't have to rush back in. But whatever "now what" we do decide on... It comes after you take a bath.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Here's one. 25-year-old man with numbness and tingling in his legs and a speech disorder, three— "

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Anybody see House?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's 10 :00 A.M. I'd be worried if he was here. This 25-year-old—

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He was in pretty bad shape yesterday after his patient died.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House has lost patients before. We all have. He's a big boy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You didn't see him.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Best thing we can do for him now is find him a new puzzle to solve.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thus bringing us back to my 25-year-old—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yet you're the only person here without a potential case in front of you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I haven't found the right one yet.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh. I–I thought maybe it was because you were asking for a leave of absence and wouldn't have time to see a case through.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I didn't say anything.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He didn't...I saw an envelope on House's desk with your name on it, so naturally, I... steamed it open.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What's wrong with you? You steam an envelope to keep it secret.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which is why I just ripped it. You gonna tell us where you're going?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Sure sounds like a no.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: There's glass everywhere. Couldn't you have just put the mirror down nice and gentle?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was in a mood.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'll be right back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't get that.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It could be important.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is important. Right now, we are more important than what's going on at the hospital. So...I say we turn off our phones and... give the morning to us.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Okay. I'll go turn it off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you. You're distracted.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, you are. You turned off your phone but you're still wondering, "What could it have been? What emergency will bring down the entire hospital if I decide to take the morning off?"

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm sorry. The clinic is facing reduced funding from the state. Nurse Jeffrey is filing his 12th H.R. complaint. Richardson is threatening to quit because he's basically been a prisoner at the hospital for almost a week.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Richardson?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The neurosurgeon. He's the only one I have right now, which means he has to stay on the premises at all times, or else the hospital technically isn't a level one trauma center.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which means?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'd have to shut down the E.R., transfer all of the patients out of the ICU...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, stop. Turn around.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you need to relax.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am going to make you a magical bath. It will have bubbles and eastern spices and blue diamonds and green clovers... transformative powers. But… I must have solitude to focus my creative energies.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting factoid. Did you know that if we don't have a neurosurgeon on the premises, all the puppies in the world will choke to death on all the babies?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah. You got a note from Thirteen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So how come we don't have, like, five neurosurgeons?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, we had three, but Kapur retired, and then Nichols just took off for his daughter's wedding.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've got good news. For the next 16 hours, you are the new neurosurgeon.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not a neurosurgeon.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which would matter if you actually had to do some neurosurgery.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House, it's a hospital. The odds of having to do neurosurgery are higher than in most places.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If an EMT calls in with a brain or spinal trauma, just divert them to the nearest hospital. All you gotta do is stand around and keep the E.R. open. It's an administrative problem, not a medical one.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House, where the hell are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. Glad you're on it. All systems go!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why are you going to Rome? I found the flight information in your locker.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I love how everyone thinks it's so quaint and childlike of me to expect a modicum of privacy around here.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Your flight's tomorrow. What's so urgent in Rome?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I hear they want to tear down the Coliseum to build a karaoke bar.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The Buona Speranza Medical Center in Rome is doing a Huntington's trial.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Seriously, I live to sing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I know that they've been doing fetal neural transplantation. I also know that their subjects have increased risk of intracranial hemorrhage. This isn't the time to join a trial. This research is in its infancy. So's your condition.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You read my note. You go through my locker. And then you decide you want to round it off by lecturing me on my life choices?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm worried about you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Oh. Well, that makes it all right then.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what, exactly, is this? It can still be open and casual and fun if you want.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Open? You think I want to see other people?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, last night was emotional for you. We both lost that patient. We watched people die. I came back here and I went for the Vicodin, and you... dumped your fiancé and you came here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Which I don't regret.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not saying you do. I'm just saying it was an impulsive move.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Don't do this. Why do you have to analyze things to death? Why can't you just... let it be nice?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. That was very anti-secret bath.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The secret bath is... burning my lady parts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How do you think my anus feels? Burning means it's working.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Can we get out now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was so waiting for you to say that.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Could I speak to Dr. Jankowski? No. I don't need to disturb him in Bermuda.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy's phone keeps going directly to voicemail, and I need to get a neurosurgeon to replace Dr. Richardson for the day or else she's screwed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm a neurosurgeon.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: No. You're not.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I've cut into people's heads more often—

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: You did a residency in neurosurgery at the University of Melbourne, but you were never board-certified.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You've worked here two days. How—

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy's first assignment was for me to get to know everything about Dr. House's team... and not to believe anything any of them told me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm... not a neurosurgeon?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And...voila! For the first course, I flaked some tender young ears of corn on the side of assorted exotic breakfast meats in a chili sauce reduction.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And the... second course?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A single grape. To cleanse the palate. Which is kind of a waste, 'cause there is no third course.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm glad we stayed in. This is actually... pretty good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can always tell when you lie. I mean always.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I slept with my freshman roommate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A lie.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: A truth.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have a tell.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: First admit that you were lying.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Fine. I was lying. My sexual history is boring and predictable. What is my tell?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you kidding? If I tell you your tell, you'll get rid of it, then I won't be able to tell.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, then you have to tell me something I don't already know about you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Even though, technically, you didn't tell me something that I didn't already know about you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Quit being so damn logical and just tell me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I used to have an intimate relationship with a photograph of you. Well, actually, a sock and a photograph.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was lying.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The photo you took of me as Sleeping Beauty on Halloween. Why else would you take that picture?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have to pee. Ha! You can't tell. 'Cause actually, I have to poo.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cuddy's assistant decided to use his own brain. Who put that idiot idea into his head?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Perhaps you could follow the same advice.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He notified DPH that there's no neurosurgeon on the premises. Said he legally had to, which he legally had to.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sounds like you got the situation under control.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. I don't. You know I don't. When DPH shows up, they're gonna shut down our E.R. This can't be fixed. It is what it is, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. I've got every faith in your ability to solve the problem.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I have called every neurosurgeon within a 45-mile radius — nothing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe House is just testing us.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's always testing us.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Test or not, it's a problem.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not our problem. Why the hell is it House's problem?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Where the hell is Cuddy? We either report this, and half the hospital gets shut down, or we cover it up and run the risk that the entire hospital gets shut down.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Or we get Richardson.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's sick.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And we're doctors. We get people better.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Fing Fong Fooey?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Tchuh.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Can I open them yet?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just a second. Okay. Hold out your hand.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I always wanted to open a bottle of champagne with one of these things. You might wanna stand behind me for this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay... Yeah! Mm, I think I might have... got that slightly wrong. Well, good thing I got a case.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, open up. We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Just let him in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If we just ignore him, he'll go away.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think he finally left. But just in case he hasn't, what can we do that does not involve talking? You turned on my ringer!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I know you're in there. I can hear your cell phone ringing.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Just let him in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No! He's like a stray... he'll eat everything, shed all over the place, and crap on the floor. Hi. This is Gregory House. I can't take your call at the moment. Please leave a message. If this is Wilson, I'm fine, not suicidal, not on drugs, coping very well with the loss of my last patient. So feel free to go about your day without worry. Beep!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House. You can't just not show up to work. What's Cuddy gonna say?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If this is still Wilson... she gave me the day off. And tomorrow. Okay, maybe not tomorrow. But today. I'm fine. Now, go away. Beep!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you're not in tomorrow, I'll be back.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Look, you're the only neurosurgeon we've got. You have to suck it up and go back to the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We're not asking you to operate, just to be there.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: Unless you can transport this t–toilet with me, I'm not leaving the room.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll get a bucket.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: You're missing the point. I ate bad sushi. I'm sick. Go away.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We can give you promethazine for the nausea.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: Already took it. And trimethobenzamide.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Maybe this isn't food poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Whatever it is, it must have damaged the lining of his stomach. Till that heals, nothing's gonna work.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So we need to treat both that and the nausea.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And whatever's wrong with him.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We give him ondansetron and prostaglandins.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And whatever's wrong with him. Neither of those will treat any possible underlying condition.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Who cares? He's not our patient. The hospital is.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: I can... hear you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're pretty miserable, aren't you? Would you be willing to take a... fairly risky drug if it would make it all go away?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why didn't you let him in?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were thinking about Wilson while we were having sex? That's so cool! So was I.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You were hiding me from him. Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was not hiding you. I was protecting your privacy. Wasn't sure if you were ready to go public with the whole... "us" thing yet.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why would I be doing all this if I wanted it to be private?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Have you read the list of side effects on those drugs? We could crash his BP.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I haven't heard a thump, so I assume he's still quietly puking.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We could be making him worse.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Bigger picture — we're making the hospital better. We can test for whatever you want to test him for once he's stable enough to get back to the hospital. Now, stop being a girl and move. So you gonna ask me about this Huntington's trial, and by ask, I mean give me your opinion?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. There is one thing, though. Will you have sex with me?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, this trial means you're leaving right away. I was playing a long game. Deadlines have been moved up.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: Wow. That stuff is good.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Think you can make it back to the hospital?

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: Uh-huh. That lamp is shiny. I mean, the way it shines is... shiny.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I take it this is one of the side effects of the drugs.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Who cares? Let's go.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think I'm afraid to go public? I'm gonna prove you wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: With a sex tape. We'll send it to Wilson. It's a win-win. We get to do it again, and... he might actually learn something.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It sounds like someone's trying to break in.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Stuck? Bummer. Looks painful. Chamomile or English breakfast?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Would you stop being an ass and pull me out of here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You didn't get my message earlier?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. But as someone once told me, everybody lies.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm fine. Just staying home, chill-laxin'.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your patient died, you ignore my calls, and you won't open the door. I don't think you're fine. I think you might be throwing away a drug-free year.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or... I'm ignoring you for a different reason. Sex with my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hmm. Will you please just — please let me in? Thank you. And since when did you start referring to hookers as girlfriends?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's not a hooker.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What are — wha — really?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Begins with "C", ends with “uddy.”

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How many Vicodin have you taken?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm serious. Cuddy and I are now Cuddy and I. There's an "I" in Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House... it's okay. Almost all addicts relapse a few times.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's in my bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're hallucinating, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Honey buns! We got company.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Pupils are normal. Pulse is normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Better than that. They're both totally awesome. I'm not on drugs.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So... why did you lie about Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To make a point. Probably something to do with shutting you up. It's my go-to idea.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You do seem okay. You want me to stick around? I could do my usual thing of pretending I like watching monster truck rallies, if that would make you feel better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. You go.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House... you could have died. You had a patient who did die in your arms. You shouldn't be alone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. That's why I called a hooker. Now, go away. 'Cause... you'll be extra.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Are you really okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you gonna break in again? You checked my pulse. You checked my pupils. I'll mail you the urine sample.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: How come I've never even m–met you guys? Y–you're like the greatest... guys. You know fluorescent lights flicker at the same frequency as the human brain?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You know the human brain doesn't flicker?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Doesn't take a brain surgeon to figure out that he can't perform brain surgery. What's wrong with him?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: High... blood sugar. He'll be fine as soon as we rehydrate him.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: That's a relief.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Thank God. DPH guy will be here in 20 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What is wrong with him?

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: High blood sugar. You just said so.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Chase is running labs. Right now the top two contenders are hepatitis and peptic ulcer disease.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So... is today really your last day?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Flying out tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How long a leave are you taking?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Depends.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: On the drug trial. Sounds risky.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yadda, yadda. You don't think I should do it. Message heard.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. I approve. Living fast and dying young is crap. If you have a chance to get better... I say good for you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I brought Wilson in here specifically to go public, just like you requested.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I pressured you. Wilson coming through the window pressured you. If you're forced into this, it's not gonna work. Do you have any response to that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Game on.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Is he better?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: You're lying to me again, aren't you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Then we're screwed. Don't we have to tell—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh! Damn. Dr. Richardson's prepping for surgery.

utterance.speaker: Malkin
utterance.content: Yeah. I need to talk to him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's prepping for surgery.

utterance.speaker: Malkin
utterance.content: So you said. I just need to confirm he is who you say he is and that he's a licensed neurosurgeon.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, here's his paperwork. His hospital I.D.'s right there. You can... see it's him.

utterance.speaker: Malkin
utterance.content: Yeah. I should still talk to him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They've already scrubbed. He'd have to be re-sterilized. The patient's anesthesia would have to be adjusted.

utterance.speaker: Malkin
utterance.content: Why did you report he wasn't here?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: I must have... misunderstood.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: Oh... why... why... why is it so... so hot in there? Oh! Ahh. La-dee-dah. Woodstock, baby.

utterance.speaker: Malkin
utterance.content: Is he stoned?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. We're pretty sure he's got—

utterance.speaker: Malkin
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sure you have an explanation, but I don't care. See, you need to have a doctor on the premises who can actually do neurosurgery. Tell the attending to divert all ambulances away and start calling other hospitals and see who can take your stabilized ICU patients. Those departments are shutting down.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: "Design" for five points.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: "Hear."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got it. Both versions.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: "Love." You didn't see love.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. I didn't think you'd take my lack of board game skills so personally.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why didn't you tell me you loved me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Didn't a wise woman once say — and by once, I mean two hours ago — "why do you have to analyze everything to death? Why can't this just be nice?"

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I told you I loved you. You didn't tell me you loved me back. You don't think that should give me cause for concern?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. 'Cause words don't matter. Actions matter.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're really gonna take a stand here. You can't say—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because... I forgot to grab a "v."

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Lobe. Gets you one point. One.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Labs show he's negative for everything.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm guessing at least one of them is wrong.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Who cares? The E.R. and the ICU are half-empty and the place is crawling with suits. It's over.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You do know we still have a sick patient here. Right? He's the guy sitting right behind you, taking off his clothes again.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Uh, why don't you just sit down and take it easy?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He should be coming down by now.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: And yet... I'm not.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What if his behavior isn't a side effect of the ondansetron? What if it's a symptom?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Thank you. What causes delirium and nausea?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's been stuck here in the hospital a few days. Nobody else is sick, so it can't be environmental.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: Not exactly stuck. I snuck out. Freedom is my birthright.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Where did you go?

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: The Seafood Festival at the Convention Center.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We're screwed. Seafood Festival has stuff from all around the world in combinations nobody ever thought of. We could be here all year.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You had shrimp?

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And crab? Lobster?

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And...

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: I ate whatever looked good.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Did you eat any roe? Little tiny eggs?

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: Nummy!

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Toad eggs will cause nausea, and they can get you high. If I'm right, the antidote is fast-acting. If we can get him to keep his clothes on long enough, he can pass as a functioning neurosurgeon.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Um... France. And not Paris or the Rivera, but there's this place in Normandy. It's on a... a tidal island. Everyone who's not staying in one of the small inns has to leave before the tide comes in. You have this 900-year-old fortress all to yourself. It's called...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mont Saint-Michel?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's it. Have you been there?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. But I got a pretty good idea what it looks like.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: H–how did you know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You used to have a picture of it as a screensaver.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That was years ago.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I guess it's a memorable place. Now, unfortunately, we can't fly straight to Normandy, but the layover in London's only a couple of hours.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's all there. All you gotta do is click confirm, and we're eating croissant and being insulted by stinky people this time tomorrow. Don't worry. I used Wilson's credit card.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I can't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm kidding. I used your credit card.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The hospital does not need your body. I do.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So does my daughter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, she can come too. Or to grandmother's house she can go.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: This is crazy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So...you break off your engagement, but you won't adjust your schedule.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I can't. Not... tomorrow. But... two weekends from now. If Rachel's gonna stay with my mom, I'm gonna need a little bit of prep time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: What if it doesn't work? What if I stay this way forever?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The antidote works quickly. If we're right, you should be back to your old self in no time.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: My old self was boring. Can't we keep the new self?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Just lay down, and stop unbuttoning.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm sorry that I read your note and looked in your locker.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You get used to that kind of thing around here.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Do you have anyone going with you to Rome?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Is that your passive-aggressive way of asking me if I'm seeing somebody else?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I hope you are. I mean... I hope you have someone with you. If I'm scared about this, I can't imagine how you must feel. You shouldn't be alone. If you want... I could fly over for a few days. Friends.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I appreciate that, but I think I'll be okay. I guess we took the long way around to being friends, huh?

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: I guess we all did.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thank you. For everything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're welcome. For everything.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'll see you tomorrow. I really do have to leave.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What's the problem?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This isn't gonna work.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's it? You can't just... say that and shut up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's just a statement of fact. It's not a debatable proposition.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Right. Because you can see the future.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. But I can see the past. And you're gonna remember all the horrible things I've done, and you're gonna try to convince yourself that I've changed. And I'm gonna start doing those horrible things again, because I haven't changed. Then you'll realize that... I'm an insane choice for someone who has a kid. And from there, it's a short step to the inevitable conclusion that all of this... was a mistake. Tell me any of that isn't true.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Mercy doesn't have enough room in their ICU to handle the overflow, so—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Don't worry about it. I believe you wanted to talk to Dr. Richardson, our neurosurgeon?

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: I'm sorry that we met under such trying circumstances. I hope you restore our rating as a level one Trauma Center and reopen the E.R. and the ICU immediately.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: An accidental case of poisoning. Dr. Richardson has been treated and is ready to resume work.

utterance.speaker: Malkin
utterance.content: Hmm. Touch your nose with your index finger and tell me how you treat a cerebral contusion.

utterance.speaker: Richardson
utterance.content: Uh, I–I–I would watch for edema and transtentorial herniation.

utterance.speaker: Malkin
utterance.content: Good enough. Turn it around.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're gonna be up late. Next time... Avoid responsibility. Cake? Taub thought we should have a little party to see you off properly. He gets sentimental about these things.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I never should have flashed him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Speaking of which... Earlier today I asked you about... having sex. You gave me a look that almost certainly could only mean no. However, on the other hand, I'd be remiss if I... didn't follow up and confirm. See? It's the same look. So if it didn't mean no the first time, then...

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No. No. No, no. No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Okay. No pressure.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Does that method ever work?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: At least once. Mm, I'm, um... Getting mixed signals.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: See you at the cake.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The only time you're afraid is when you're happy. You just don't expect it to last.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause it doesn't.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You don't know that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've done horrible things to you. And I'll do horrible things again to you. But because of one stupid moment with a dying girl and a pile of rubble... you think I can change. Tell me where I'm wrong.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't want you to change. I know you're screwed up. I know you are always gonna be screwed up. But you're the most incredible man I've ever known. You are always gonna be... the most incredible man I have ever known. So unless you're breaking up with me, I am going home now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Where's Thirteen?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't think she's coming.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's not going to Rome.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You mean she changed her mind?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I called the hospital in Rome to see when she was schedule for surgery.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why would you—

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Doesn't matter. Point is, she's not even in the trial. Never heard of her. She's been lying to us all day.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, have you tried—

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Both her phone lines have been disconnected. She's just gone.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's gonna be great.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.
